etymology.description: A bent-over figure with long hair, an old man, as component of 老(老) (lǎo, 'old') and 孝(孝) (xiào, 'filial piety')
etymology.interpretation: This character depicts an elderly person with long hair, symbolizing age, and is used as a component to indicate 'old'. The image of a bent figure emphasizes the physical traits associated with aging.

examples.chinese: 那位⺹先生(那位⺹先生)，智慧过人(智慧過人)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi lǎo xiānshēng, zhìhuì guòrén.
examples.english: That old gentleman is extremely wise.

examples.chinese: 我的⺹朋友(我的⺹朋友)，总爱分享旧日趣事(總愛分享舊日趣事)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de lǎo péngyǒu, zǒng ài fēnxiǎng jiùrì qùshì.
examples.english: My old friend always loves to share stories of the past.

examples.chinese: 他收藏的⺹物品(他收藏的⺹物品)，充满岁月痕迹(充滿歲月痕跡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shōucáng de lǎo wùpǐn, chōngmǎn suìyuè hénjì.
examples.english: The old items he collects are full of traces of time.
